Candidate :  Lucie Boost  
 
 
PERSONAL DETAILS  
  
Location:   Belgium - Brussels  
 
 
QUALIFICATIONS  
 
Licentiate/Master Political Science, speci alized in International Relations – VUB (Free University of 
Brussels), Brussels ▪ 1998  
 
European Politics – Erasmus Exchange – University of Central Lancashire ▪ 1996  
Thesis - The Future of the WEU: An Evaluation of the British, French and German Positi ons (Western 
European Union, security and defense alliance)  
 
Languages  
Dutch  (Fluent )  
English (Fluent)  
French (Fluent)  
German (Good knowle dge) 
Spanish (Basic)  
Italian (B asic) 
 
 
CARE ER SUMMARY  
 
May 200 7 to date  Equinor, Brussels  
 
July 2020  to date   
Position: Lead Consultant Government Relations and Public Affairs  
• Influence directly and through associations on Fit for 55 and winter packages (Natural 
gas/Hydrogen package, Methane Emissions Regulation and CCS Vision/CCS Forum) at the 
level of Commission Cabinets, MEPs, Energy Attachés etc  
. 
March 2019 – July 2020  
Position : Lead Adviso r Gov. and Reg. Affairs, MPR MT GRA  
 
May 2017 – March 2019  
Position: Advisor Gov. and Reg. Affairs, MPR MT GRA  
• Report/influence/advocate on national policy and regulatory affairs related to natural gas, 
hydrogen & offshore wind for The Netherlands, Belgium and Italy (flow assurance, reporting, 
energy transition, NECPs, identification of business opportunities for natural gas and new 
gasses)  
 • Report/influence/advocate follow -up of European regulation  on natural gas, EU Network Code 
implementation, ACER, ENTSOG, Madrid Forum - 2 main streams: new gasses reg; framework 
(gas taxonomy, GoOs, blending vs hydrogen network, CCS), gas market liberalization is SEE 
countries.  
 
March 2010 – May 2017  Statoil, Brussels  
Position: Sales Manager, MPR MT OMA MAR GMA   
• Sale of Natural Gas to largest Industrial End Users and Retail markets in Belgium and The 
Netherlands, France  
• Follow up of regulatory changes and its impact for Belgian customers, e.g. CREG Cascade fee 
project  
• Realized returning customer basis as well as target market share improvement from 5 to +30%  
 
August 2006 – March 2010  Katoen Natie, Antwerp  
Position: Key Account Manager  
• Key account management. Development and/or simplification of whole (or part) of logisti cal 
operations and value added services and import for specialty chemicals industry, management 
of on -site operations, etc.  
 
March 2000 – August 2006  Eu-Lex IPG, Antwerp  
Position: Association Manager  
• Daily management of world -wide network of independent law and accountancy firms, board 
meetings, multi -disciplinary, LT analysis, setting up networking events and conferences world -
wide, financial management  
 
January 1999 – March 2000  Interel Mariën, Brussels  
Position:  Research Manager   
• Responsible for search tasks for Belgian lobbying department  
 
January 1999 – March 2000  Interel Mariën, Brussels  
Position: Account Executive  
• Number 1 Belgian PR company – Department Corporate & Crisis Communication  
 
September – October 199 8 Consulate of the Republic of Lithuania, Antwerp  
Position: Internship  
 
 
COMMENT  
 
Highly skilled, result oriented and multilingual network er 
A can -do mentality with excellent language and communications skills at ease in a multi -cultural 
environment and a strong result -oriented personality. Over time she built a wide contact -base in the 
energy industry through direct interaction with relevant pub lic institutions and through representation in 
different associations (IOGP/Eurogas/ EFET/Business Europe/ZEP/Hydrogen Europe).  
 
Working on legislative proposals she has  experience in putting together a team with regulatory and 
technical experts in creating company positions, consultation responses and amendments while taking 
into account internal approval processes. She has  solid energy market knowledge and experience that 
she can draw upon, while not losing track of the bigger picture and has a genuine inte rest in developing 
 her career further with an emphasis on European energy transition (natural gas, hydrogen, CCS) - 
topics which she is  passionate about.

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
